com.github.jonathanxd.iutils.collection

Interface Grabber<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Elements type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGrabber, ArrayGrabber, ListGrabber, StringCharGrabber

    public interface Grabber<T>
    Grabber of elements, when you grab an element, your index is marked as excluded.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<T> allElements()
      All elements
      int allElementsSize()
      Return number of all elements (included and excluded)
      int calculateExcludedElements()
      Calculate number of excluded elements Use hasIncludedElements() instead of this if you want to know if hasn't included elements (best performance).
      int calculateIncludedElements()
      Calculate number of non-excluded elements Use hasIncludedElements() instead of this if you want to know if has included elements (best performance).
      default T[] collectRemainingToArray(java.lang.Class<T[]> arrayClass)
      Collect all remaining elements (non-excluded index elements)
      default T[] collectRemainingToArray(int amount, java.lang.Class<T[]> arrayClass)
      Collect a amount of remaining elements
      T[] collectRemainingToArray(java.util.function.IntFunction<T[]> generator)
      Collect all remaining elements (non-excluded index elements)
      T[] collectRemainingToArray(int amount, java.util.function.IntFunction<T[]> generator)
      Collect a amount of remaining elements
      java.util.List<T> collectRemainingToList()
      Collect all remaining elements (non-excluded index elements)
      java.util.List<T> collectRemainingToList(int amount)
      Collect a amount of remaining elements
      java.util.List<T> excludedElements()
      Excluded elements
      void foreachRemaining(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
      Foreach all remaining elements (non-excluded index elements)
      void foreachRemaining(int amount, java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
      Foreach a amount of remaining elements (non-excluded index elements)
      void foreachRemaining(int amount, ObjIntIntConsumer<T> consumer)
      Foreach a amount of remaining elements and indexes (non-excluded index elements) First Object passed to consumer is the elements, the first int passed to consumer is the included index and the last int is the index in the element table
      void foreachRemaining(ObjIntIntConsumer<T> consumer)
      Foreach all remaining elements and indexes (non-excluded index elements) First Object passed to consumer is the elements, the first int passed to consumer is the included index and the last int is the index in element table
      T grab()
      Grab an element at current non-excluded index + 1 and mark element index as "excluded"
      T grab(int index)
      Grab element at a index and mark index as excluded
      T[] grabAll(java.util.function.IntFunction<T[]> arrayFactory, java.util.function.BiPredicate<T,State> predicate)
      Grab multiple elements.
      boolean hasIncludedElements()
      Return true if has included elements.
      java.util.List<T> includedElements()
      Non-Excluded elements
      boolean isExcluded(int index)
      Return true if specified index is excluded
      Grabber<T> makeClone()
      Create a clone of grabber (preserve state) This operation doesn't consume elements
      <U> Grabber<U> map(java.util.function.Function<T,U> function)
      Map remaining to new Grabber (excluded elements are not included in the result) Elements will be consumed
      <U> Grabber<U> mapAll(java.util.function.Function<T,U> function)
      Map all elements to new Grabber (excluded elements will be mapped, but remain excluded) Elements will be consumed
      <U> Grabber<U> mapAllToIncluded(java.util.function.Function<T,U> function)
      Map all elements to new Grabber (as included) (excluded elements will be mapped and your indexes will be included) Elements will be consumed

    • Method Detail

      • grab

        T grab()
throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Grab an element at current non-excluded index + 1 and mark element index as "excluded"
        Returns:
        Element at current non-excluded index + 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if has no elements to grab.

      • grab

        T grab(int index)
throws ExcludedElementIndexException
        Grab element at a index and mark index as excluded
        Parameters:
        index - Element index
        Returns:
        Element at a index
        Throws:
        ExcludedElementIndexException - if element index is excluded

      • grabAll

        T[] grabAll(java.util.function.IntFunction<T[]> arrayFactory,
            java.util.function.BiPredicate<T,State> predicate)
        Grab multiple elements.
        Parameters:
        predicate - Predicate to test start of grab and end of grab (if predicate accept element, grab current element and start grabbing elements, if predicate reject element, grab current element and stop grabbing elements). First argument of predicate is the element, the second argument is the state.
        Returns:
        Array with all elements grabbed.

      • isExcluded

        boolean isExcluded(int index)
        Return true if specified index is excluded
        Parameters:
        index - Index
        Returns:
        True if specified index is excluded

      • map

        <U> Grabber<U> map(java.util.function.Function<T,U> function)
        Map remaining to new Grabber (excluded elements are not included in the result) Elements will be consumed
        Type Parameters:
        U - New Type
        Returns:
        New grabber mapped to new type

      • mapAll

        <U> Grabber<U> mapAll(java.util.function.Function<T,U> function)
        Map all elements to new Grabber (excluded elements will be mapped, but remain excluded) Elements will be consumed
        Type Parameters:
        U - New Type
        Returns:
        New grabber mapped to new type

      • mapAllToIncluded

        <U> Grabber<U> mapAllToIncluded(java.util.function.Function<T,U> function)
        Map all elements to new Grabber (as included) (excluded elements will be mapped and your indexes will be included) Elements will be consumed
        Type Parameters:
        U - New Type
        Returns:
        New grabber mapped to new type

        Foreach all remaining elements (non-excluded index elements)

      • foreachRemaining

        void foreachRemaining(ObjIntIntConsumer<T> consumer)
        Foreach all remaining elements and indexes (non-excluded index elements) First Object passed to consumer is the elements, the first int passed to consumer is the included index and the last int is the index in element table

      • foreachRemaining

        void foreachRemaining(int amount,
                      java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
               throws CannotCollectElementsException
        Foreach a amount of remaining elements (non-excluded index elements)
        Throws:
        CannotCollectElementsException - if cannot collect all elements

      • foreachRemaining

        void foreachRemaining(int amount,
                      ObjIntIntConsumer<T> consumer)
               throws CannotCollectElementsException
        Foreach a amount of remaining elements and indexes (non-excluded index elements) First Object passed to consumer is the elements, the first int passed to consumer is the included index and the last int is the index in the element table
        Throws:
        CannotCollectElementsException - if cannot collect all elements

      • calculateIncludedElements

        int calculateIncludedElements()
        Calculate number of non-excluded elements Use hasIncludedElements() instead of this if you want to know if has included elements (best performance).
        Returns:
        Number of non-excluded elements

      • calculateExcludedElements

        int calculateExcludedElements()
        Calculate number of excluded elements Use hasIncludedElements() instead of this if you want to know if hasn't included elements (best performance).
        Returns:
        Number of excluded elements
